trans-unit.source: Combines two regions and stores the result in a third region

seg-source.mrk: Combines two regions and stores the result in a third region

target.mrk: Combines two regions and stores the result in a third region

seg-source.mrk: Parameters

target.mrk: Parameters

trans-unit.source: Handle to a new region with dimensions defined by combining two other regions. (This region must exist before CombineRgn is called.)

seg-source.mrk: Handle to a new region with dimensions defined by combining two other regions.
(This region must exist before CombineRgn is called.)

target.mrk: Handle to a new region with dimensions defined by combining two other regions.
(This region must exist before CombineRgn is called.)

trans-unit.source: Handle to the first of two regions to be combined.

seg-source.mrk: Handle to the first of two regions to be combined.

target.mrk: Handle to the first of two regions to be combined.

trans-unit.source: Handle to the second of two regions to be combined.

seg-source.mrk: Handle to the second of two regions to be combined.

target.mrk: Handle to the second of two regions to be combined.

trans-unit.source: Specifies a mode indicating how the two regions will be combined. This parameter can be one of the following values.

seg-source.mrk: Specifies a mode indicating how the two regions will be combined.
This parameter can be one of the following values.

target.mrk: Specifies a mode indicating how the two regions will be combined.
This parameter can be one of the following values.

trans-unit.source: $RGN_AND - Creates the intersection of the two combined regions.

seg-source.mrk: $RGN_AND - Creates the intersection of the two combined regions.

target.mrk: $RGN_AND - Creates the intersection of the two combined regions.

trans-unit.source: $RGN_COPY - Creates a copy of the region identified by $hRgnSrc1.

seg-source.mrk: $RGN_COPY - Creates a copy of the region identified by $hRgnSrc1.

target.mrk: $RGN_COPY - Creates a copy of the region identified by $hRgnSrc1.

trans-unit.source: $RGN_DIFF - Combines the parts of $hRgnSrc1 that are not part of $hRgnSrc2.

seg-source.mrk: $RGN_DIFF - Combines the parts of $hRgnSrc1 that are not part of $hRgnSrc2.

target.mrk: $RGN_DIFF - Combines the parts of $hRgnSrc1 that are not part of $hRgnSrc2.

trans-unit.source: $RGN_OR - Creates the union of two combined regions.

seg-source.mrk: $RGN_OR - Creates the union of two combined regions.

target.mrk: $RGN_OR - Creates the union of two combined regions.

trans-unit.source: $RGN_XOR - Creates the union of two combined regions except for any overlapping areas.

seg-source.mrk: $RGN_XOR - Creates the union of two combined regions except for any overlapping areas.

target.mrk: $RGN_XOR - Creates the union of two combined regions except for any overlapping areas.

seg-source.mrk: Return Value

target.mrk: Return Value

trans-unit.source: Specifies the type of the resulting region. It can be one of the following values.

seg-source.mrk: Specifies the type of the resulting region.
It can be one of the following values.

target.mrk: Specifies the type of the resulting region.
It can be one of the following values.

seg-source.mrk: $NULLREGION - The region is empty.

target.mrk: $NULLREGION - The region is empty.

trans-unit.source: $SIMPLEREGION - The region is a single rectangle.

seg-source.mrk: $SIMPLEREGION - The region is a single rectangle.

target.mrk: $SIMPLEREGION - The region is a single rectangle.

trans-unit.source: $COMPLEXREGION - The region is more than a single rectangle.

seg-source.mrk: $COMPLEXREGION - The region is more than a single rectangle.

target.mrk: $COMPLEXREGION - The region is more than a single rectangle.

seg-source.mrk: 0 - No region is created.

target.mrk: 0 - No region is created.

seg-source.mrk: Remarks

target.mrk: Remarks

trans-unit.source: The two regions are combined according to the specified mode.

seg-source.mrk: The two regions are combined according to the specified mode.

target.mrk: The two regions are combined according to the specified mode.

trans-unit.source: The three regions need not be distinct. For example, the $hRgnSrc1 parameter can equal the $hRgnDest parameter.

seg-source.mrk: The three regions need not be distinct.
For example, the $hRgnSrc1 parameter can equal the $hRgnDest parameter.

target.mrk: The three regions need not be distinct.
For example, the $hRgnSrc1 parameter can equal the $hRgnDest parameter.
